Q: How much data do you get from the fleet? 

Karpathy doesn't say, but says it's not about the *amount* of data, but the quality. "We are really strategic and how we pick and choose and the trigger infrastructure that we've built up is quite sophisticated"

1120415662969634816.text: One reason Musk is so confident Tesla doesn't need LIDAR? This is the kind of 3D reconstruction Tesla can do of a scene just from its cameras (though unclear if they're doing that in real time)pic.twitter.com/s6QRoIuafN

1120412693192687616.text: Karpathy explaining that Tesla has the ability to, when it discovers things the neural net doesn't understand, call on the fleet to find similar examples. 1120408669164834817.text: Tesla's senior director of AI Andrej Karpathy is now on stage, will be talking about Autopilot software & vision systemspic.twitter.com/07DXmsadUO

1120408329384353799.text: MUSK: "If the simulation fully captured the real world, well, I mean that would be prove that we're living in a simulation, I think. It doesn't. I wish."

1120408055722721280.text: Asked about Waymo's apparent simulation advantage, Musk says: "We have a quite a good simulation too, but it just does not capture the long tail of weird things that happen in the real world." Says real world is "really weird & messy," so Tesla's customer fleet is an advantage

1120406952188743683.text: Musk: "If someone really good started right now they could have what we have in 3 years. But in 2 years we’ll have something 3x better."

1120406191446818817.text: Musk says second-gen custom Autopilot chip will be 3X better and is about 2 years away.

1120405638419496960.text: MUSK: "LIDAR is a fool's errand. And anyone who is relying on LIDAR is doomed. Expensive sensors that are unnecessary. It's like having a whole bunch of appendices."

1120404380749115395.text: Musk says Tesla is already halfway through the design of the second generation of this chip.

1120403847594291200.text: "Not best by a small margin, best by a huge margin," Musk says.

1120403784251969537.text: Musk says all Model S, X, and 3 being made right now have this chip. "At first it seems improbable. How could it be that Tesla, who has never designed a chip before, would design the best chip in the world? But that is objectively what has occurred."

If you’re interested, I'd advise reading the whole thing: https://www.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.205919/gov.uscourts.dcd.205919.1.0.pdf …

As for the impact, we’ll see. Consensus seems to be that, even if the Trump admin gets its rollback, there will be endless court battles like this one that might kneecap the attempt. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

1115731819104821249.text: Anyway, good on CARB for trying to do this. The California agency was also instrumental in exposing the Volkswagen Dieselgate scandal. One of the most important state agencies when it comes to fighting for the public health of all Americans right now.

1115730932781203457.text: But CARB argues that IHS Markit allows customers who buy data from it to release the information in aggregate (otherwise how would anyone ever know what IHS Markit's data says), and is trying to compel EPA/NHTSA to do that.pic.twitter.com/76prh9DJHF

1115730932043063296.text: Another ex: EPA/NHTSA used data from IHS Markit to calculate the future fatalities (another crux of their argument), but didn't include that data in the proposal. They wouldn't let CARB FOIA it either because it's "related to trade secrets and commercial or financial information"

1115726986771664901.text: Eg: EPA/NHTSA used an oft-updated battery pack cost modeling tool made by Argonne National Laboratory. It was a crucial piece of the Trump admin's proposed rollback. But EPA/NHTSA couldn't agree on which version of the tool it used, or in some cases didn't even knowpic.twitter.com/WoofBWDbpI

1115726986008252417.text: The complaint goes into specific detail about what CARB asked for in its requests and how EPA and NHTSA failed to respond (or failed to respond timely or accurately).

1115722158179745792.text: CARB sent FOIAs for this info & this lawsuit is meant to make the agencies cough it up. CARB says EPA "failed to issue timely determinations” & NHTSA responded but withheld info "based on inadequate justifications, and in some instances without justification or explanation"

1115721201140285446.text: CARB also says "critical information underlying EPA’s and NHTSA’s analyses was not disclosed,” and calls that a “stark departure” from the norm. CARB says there are “very serious flaws” in EPA/NHTSA’s analyses and conclusions, and that the proposals "threaten public health.”

1115720910055575558.text: Anyway, back to the CARB lawsuit from Friday. CARB comes out swinging, saying the Trump proposals "contradict previous, thorough technical analyses” done by CARB *and* by previous EPA and NHTSA regimes. (Something I wrote about last April: https://www.theverge.com/2018/4/13/17226192/epa-emissions-standards-old-data-fuel-automakers?__twitter_impression=true …)

1115720212962324481.text: But their proposal didn’t address some key factors, like how a massive increase in SUV/truck sales is a big contributor to the rise of that average selling price, not *just* new emissions tech. Also didn’t address how the increase in SUVs/trucks is increasing pedestrian deaths

1115719500442238977.text: Basically they claim that, by continuing to push for SUPER fuel efficient cars, automakers will have to continue increasing the average cost of a new car, and a higher average cost means more consumers will stay in older cars that aren’t as safe.

1115718971922309120.text: Here’s some background from when the Trump EPA/NHTSA rolled out its proposal last August. The TL;DR of their argument was that dirtier cars will be safer. No, really!https://www.theverge.com/2018/8/2/17617692/trump-administration-epa-dot-lower-vehicle-fuel-efficiency-rules-greenhouse-gas-emissions …

1115717857705373699.text: Missed this because I was out last Friday, but the California Air Resources Board sued the EPA and NHTSA in an attempt to force them to cough up better justifications for the upcoming emissions rollback. It’s a *doozy*https://www.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.205919/gov.uscourts.dcd.205919.1.0.pdf …
